hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major crypto exchange news headline (e.g., liquidity provider announcement, regulatory update), if BTC's 1-hour realized volatility drops below its 24-hour rolling average by more than 30% within the 4-hour window post-news, a mean-reverting expansion in volatility and price movement will occur in the direction of the initial news sentiment within the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major news creates initial volatility spike and positioning, followed by compression as market digests. The volatility compression below recent norms suggests suppressed movement that typically reverts as delayed participants react or initial overreaction corrects. The 4-hour window allows initial noise to settle while capturing the timing edge before broader market fully incorporates the news.
entry_conditions: Major crypto news event detected (via news sentiment score > 0.5 or < -0.5 on -1 to 1 scale)
BTC 1H realized volatility (std dev of 60-min returns) < 0.7 * BTC 24H rolling realized volatility
BTC price within +/- 1.5% of price at news time
Enter long if news sentiment > 0.5, short if < -0.5

exit_conditions.take_profit: 6 hours from entry OR 3% absolute return, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.time_exit: 6 hours from entry if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 6-hour return after entry conditions met is not statistically significantly different from zero (p > 0.1) OR shows opposite direction to news sentiment more than 45% of the time in backtest.
